snippet: The authorities had been called two times to a house in Cleveland, Ohio, where three young women who disappeared about a decade ago were found.
abstract: Neighbors of Ariel Castro, owner of house in Cleveland where three young women who disappeared about a decade ago were found, express disbelief over fact that women had been held for so long in their neighborhood; some residents express anger at police for not doing enough to find missing women.

byline.original: By TRIP GABRIEL, SERGE F. KOVALESKI and ERICA GOODE
byline.contributor: Trip Gabriel reported from Cleveland, and Serge F. Kovaleski and Erica Goode from New York. Reporting was contributed by Steven Yaccino from Cleveland, Emma G. Fitzsimmons from New York, and Michael S. Schmidt from Washington. Research was contributed by Jack Begg and Sheelagh McNeill.

lead_paragraph: The authorities had been called two times to a house in Cleveland, Ohio, where three young women who disappeared about a decade ago were found.

headline.seo: Suspect in Cleveland Kidnapping Had Some Contact With Police
headline.main: Before Escape, Fleeting Clues to Long Ordeal
headline.print_headline: Before Escape, Fleeting Clues To Long Ordeal
